Returns: The desired effect. This value will never be null.
Parameters: int

int: The ID of the effect to perform: @B_android#os#VibrationEffect#EFFECT_CLICK_E@, @B_android#os#VibrationEffect#EFFECT_DOUBLE_CLICK_E@, @B_android#os#VibrationEffect#EFFECT_TICK_E@ Value is @B_android#os#VibrationEffect#EFFECT_TICK_E@, @B_android#os#VibrationEffect#EFFECT_CLICK_E@, @B_android#os#VibrationEffect#EFFECT_HEAVY_CLICK_E@, or @B_android#os#VibrationEffect#EFFECT_DOUBLE_CLICK_E@
createPredefined(int).Description: Create a predefined vibration effect. Predefined effects are a set of common vibration effects that should be identical, regardless of the app they come from, in order to provide a cohesive experience for users across the entire device. They also may be custom tailored to the device hardware in order to provide a better experience than you could otherwise build using the generic building blocks. This will fallback to a generic pattern if one exists and there does not exist a hardware-specific implementation of the effect.

Parameters: long
long: The number of milliseconds to vibrate. This must be a positive number.
int
int: The strength of the vibration. This must be a value between 1 and 255, or @B_android#os#VibrationEffect#DEFAULT_AMPLITUDE_E@.
createOneShot(long,int).Description: Create a one shot vibration. One shot vibrations will vibrate constantly for the specified period of time at the specified amplitude, and then stop.
createOneShot(long,int).FullName: public static VibrationEffect createOneShot (long milliseconds, int amplitude)

Parameters: long[]
long: The timing values of the timing / amplitude pairs. Timing values of 0 will cause the pair to be ignored.
int[]

int: The amplitude values of the timing / amplitude pairs. Amplitude values must be between 0 and 255, or equal to @B_android#os#VibrationEffect#DEFAULT_AMPLITUDE_E@. An amplitude value of 0 implies the motor is off.
int
int: The index into the timings array at which to repeat, or -1 if you you don't want to repeat.
createWaveform(long[], int[], int).Description: Create a waveform vibration. Waveform vibrations are a potentially repeating series of timing and amplitude pairs. For each pair, the value in the amplitude array determines the strength of the vibration and the value in the timing array determines how long it vibrates for. An amplitude of 0 implies no vibration (i.e. off), and any pairs with a timing value of 0 will be ignored. To cause the pattern to repeat, pass the index into the timings array at which to start the repetition, or -1 to disable repeating.
createWaveform(long[], int[], int).FullName: public static VibrationEffect createWaveform (long[] timings, int[] amplitudes, int repeat)

Parameters: long[]
long: The pattern of alternating on-off timings, starting with off. Timing values of 0 will cause the timing / amplitude pair to be ignored.
int
int: The index into the timings array at which to repeat, or -1 if you you don't want to repeat.
createWaveform(long[],int).Description: Create a waveform vibration. Waveform vibrations are a potentially repeating series of timing and amplitude pairs. For each pair, the value in the amplitude array determines the strength of the vibration and the value in the timing array determines how long it vibrates for. An amplitude of 0 implies no vibration (i.e. off), and any pairs with a timing value of 0 will be ignored. The amplitude array of the generated waveform will be the same size as the given timing array with alternating values of 0 (i.e. off) and @B_android#os#VibrationEffect#DEFAULT_AMPLITUDE_E@, starting with 0. Therefore the first timing value will be the period to wait before turning the vibrator on, the second value will be how long to vibrate at @B_android#os#VibrationEffect#DEFAULT_AMPLITUDE_E@ strength, etc. To cause the pattern to repeat, pass the index into the timings array at which to start the repetition, or -1 to disable repeating.
createWaveform(long[],int).FullName: public static VibrationEffect createWaveform (long[] timings, int repeat)

describeContents().Description: Describe the kinds of special objects contained in this Parcelable instance's marshaled representation. For example, if the object will include a file descriptor in the output of @B_android#os#Parcelable#writeToParcel_E@, the return value of this method must include the @B_android#os#Parcelable#CONTENTS_FILE_DESCRIPTOR_E@ bit.

ClassDesc: A VibrationEffect describes a haptic effect to be performed by a @B_android#os#Vibrator_E@. These effects may be any number of things, from single shot vibrations to complex waveforms.
